verses.kjv: It is reported commonly that there is fornication among you, and such fornication as is not so much as named among the Gentiles, that one should have his father’s wife.
verses.web: It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you, and such sexual immorality as is not even named among the Gentiles, that one has his father’s wife.
verses.ct: I'm hearing reports that sexual sin is happening among you — and not just ordinary sin, but the kind that even pagans would find shocking: a man is sleeping with his father's wife.

verses.kjv: And ye are puffed up, and have not rather mourned, that he that hath done this deed might be taken away from among you.
verses.web: You are arrogant, and didn’t mourn instead, that he who had done this deed might be removed from among you.
verses.ct: And instead of being grieved by this, you're proud of yourselves! You should have been mourning and removed the man who did this from your community.

verses.kjv: For I verily, as absent in body, but present in spirit, have judged already, as though I were present, concerning him that hath so done this deed,
verses.web: For I most certainly, as being absent in body but present in spirit, have already, as though I were present, judged him who has done this thing.
verses.ct: Even though I'm not there with you physically, I am with you in spirit. And I have already passed judgment on the man who did this, as if I were standing right there.

verses.kjv: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when ye are gathered together, and my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.web: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, you being gathered together, and my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.ct: When you gather together in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ — with my spirit present among you and the power of our Lord Jesus Christ —

verses.kjv: To deliver such an one unto Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.
verses.web: are to deliver such a one to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.
verses.ct: hand this man over to Satan so that his sinful nature is destroyed, and his spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord Jesus.

verses.kjv: Your glorying is not good. Know ye not that a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump?
verses.web: Your boasting is not good. Don’t you know that a little yeast leavens the whole lump?
verses.ct: Your boasting about this situation is terrible. Don't you know that a little yeast works its way through the whole batch of dough?

verses.kjv: Purge out therefore the old leaven, that ye may be a new lump, as ye are unleavened. For even Christ our passover is sacrificed for us:
verses.web: Purge out the old yeast, that you may be a new lump, even as you are unleavened. For indeed Christ, our Passover, has been sacrificed in our place.
verses.ct: Get rid of the old yeast so you can be a fresh batch of dough — which is what you already are, since Christ, our Passover lamb, has been sacrificed for us.

verses.kjv: Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old leaven, neither with the leaven of malice and wickedness; but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
verses.web: Therefore let’s keep the feast, not with old yeast, neither with the yeast of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
verses.ct: So let's celebrate the feast — not with the old yeast of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.

verses.kjv: I wrote unto you in an epistle not to company with fornicators:
verses.web: I wrote to you in my letter to have no company with sexual sinners;
verses.ct: In my earlier letter, I told you not to associate with sexually immoral people.

verses.kjv: Yet not altogether with the fornicators of this world, or with the covetous, or extortioners, or with idolaters; for then must ye needs go out of the world.
verses.web: yet not at all meaning with the sexual sinners of this world, or with the covetous and extortionists, or with idolaters; for then you would have to leave the world.
verses.ct: I didn't mean the immoral people of the world in general — or the greedy, the swindlers, or the idol worshipers. If you avoided all of them, you'd have to leave the planet entirely.

verses.kjv: But now I have written unto you not to keep company, if any man that is called a brother be a fornicator, or covetous, or an idolater, or a railer, or a drunkard, or an extortioner; with such an one no not to eat.
verses.web: But as it is, I wrote to you not to associate with anyone who is called a brother who is a sexual sinner, or covetous, or an idolater, or a slanderer, or a drunkard, or an extortionist. Don’t even eat with such a person.
verses.ct: What I meant was this: don't associate with anyone who claims to be a brother or sister in Christ but is sexually immoral, greedy, an idol worshiper, a slanderer, a drunkard, or a swindler. Don't even sit down to eat with someone like that.

verses.kjv: For what have I to do to judge them also that are without? do not ye judge them that are within?
verses.web: For what do I have to do with also judging those who are outside? Don’t you judge those who are within?
verses.ct: It's not my job to judge outsiders. But isn't it your responsibility to judge those within your own community?

verses.kjv: But them that are without God judgeth. Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person.
verses.web: But those who are outside, God judges. “Put away the wicked man from among yourselves.”
verses.ct: God will judge those on the outside. As Scripture says, "Remove the wicked person from among you."
